BodyName: Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Items.Title: AND SUCH OTHER BUSINESS AS MAY BE NECESSARY

Communication from the Mayor  -  "AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the number of intersections at which traffic control signal photo-monitoring devices may be installed and reporting upon the use of a traffic-control signal photo-monitoring system and to amend chapter 746 of the laws of 1988, amending the vehicle and traffic law, the general municipal law and the public officers law, relating to the civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; and to amend local law number 46 of the city of New York for the year 1989, amending the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to the duration of the application of provisions of such code, such chapter and such law." A.4806-A / S.2472-A
Items.MatterName: Traffic control signal photo-monitoring devices. (A.4806-A, S.2472-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Robach, Leibell, Marchi and Velella S.2765-B, and Committee on Rules, A.8401, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the twenty-five year/age fifty retirement program for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed in automotive positions".
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: 25 year/age 50 retirement program for members of the NYC employees' retirement system employed in automotive positions. (S.2765-B, A.8401)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Velella, S.4962, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed in police communications positions; and in relation to providing for employer pick up, pursuant to provisions of the internal revenue code, of certain additional member contributions required to be made by certain participants in the twenty-five year retirement programs".
Items.MatterName: Establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the NYC employees' retirement system employed in police communications positions (S.4962)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Abbate, A.4895, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed in police communications positions; and in relation to providing for employer pick up, pursuant to provisions of the internal revenue code, of certain additional member contributions required to be made by certain participants in the twenty-five year retirement programs".
Items.MatterName: Establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the NYCERS employed in police communications positions (A.4895)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills, introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1182, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.2844, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to deputy sheriffs of the city of New York who are incapacitated in the performance of their duties".
Items.MatterName: Deputy sheriffs who are incapacitated in the performance of their duties (S.1182, A.2844)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to the employment of hearing examiners by a parking violations bureau in the city of New York.  S.5349/A.8696
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Employment of hearing examiners by a parking violations bureau in NYC.  (S.5349/A.8696)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.4717, and Committee on Rules, A.8371, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the industrial and commercial incentive program".
Items.MatterName: Industrial and commercial incentive program (S.4717, A.8371)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.2365, and Assembly Members Abbate, Colton, Aubry, Seddio, Cymbrowitz and Lavelle, et al, A.5175, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing correction members of the New York city employees' retirement system to obtain retirement credit for certain periods of child care leave".
